intro: Axinaea drakei, commonly known as the Drake's axinaea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental value. Axinaea drakei is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
